intro: Poa trivialis var. sudetica, commonly known as the Sudetic meadowgrass, is a variant of the common bentgrass. It is a low-growing perennial grass species native to Central and Eastern Europe. The plant typically forms dense, mat-like tufts and has fine, wiry leaves that are often covered in a powdery bloom. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in meadows, pastures, and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important component of grassland ecosystems.
